definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
see 壓根兒|压根儿[ya4 gen1 r5]
to press/to push down/to keep under (control)/pressure

sentences.english: International pressure led to periodic crackdowns by Chinese authorities.
sentences.chinese: 迫於國際壓力，中國政府部門也曾階段性地進行打壓。

sentences.english: However, this could prolong the uncertainty that has sapped market confidence.
sentences.chinese: 但這會延長已經打壓了市場信心的政壇不穩定期。
博士狀的蠢貨打壓着真才實學。

sentences.english: It was the first time since Aug. 4 that Japan has stepped into the market to weaken the yen.
sentences.chinese: 這是自8月4日以來日本政府首次入市干預打壓日元。

sentences.english: Right now, ding Zong discovers Shen Cong acute hearing investigation behavior, adopt dozen press measure.
sentences.chinese: 此時，丁總髮現沈聰聰的調查行爲，採取打壓措施。

sentences.english: At the core of the solution are government-decreed industrial and traffic crackdowns.
sentences.chinese: 這種解決之道的核心在於政府勒令打壓工業和交通。

sentences.english: China'sleaders promise to hunt down and punish hoarders and speculators.
sentences.chinese: 中國領導人許諾打壓並懲罰囤積居奇者和投機商。

sentences.english: Although they face pressure and belittlement from China every day.
sentences.chinese: 雖然持續面對著中國的打壓。

sentences.english: The dollar also strengthened, which pushes down oil.
sentences.chinese: 美元走強也打壓了油價。

sentences.english: Their politics consisted of unstable power-plays between rival groups.
sentences.chinese: 他們的政治活動包括競爭團體間反覆多變的打壓行動。

sentences.english: Yet still so many assholes want to take him down.
sentences.chinese: 然而還有那麼多的混蛋想打壓他。

sentences.english: For years these farmers have suffered from low coffee prices.
sentences.chinese: 多年以來，這些農場一直遭受低廉咖啡收購價的打壓。

sentences.english: Another technique is impaction grafting, which is usually reserved for severe osteolysis.
sentences.chinese: 另一種技術是打壓植骨，這通常應用於嚴重骨溶解。
現在他們又打壓他的頭了。

definition: to criticize/to find fault with/to denounce
to call into question/to question (truth or validity)
to attack/to batter/(of waves) to pound against/shock/impact
to strike back/to beat back/to counterattack
to be related/to entail/to involve/joint (liability etc)
